sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个情态动词均可表示"应该，应当"之意。
means: ought to ： 侧重反映客观情况，多在涉及法律、道义、责任、义务或原则时使用。
should ： 侧重自己的主观看法，语气比ought to稍弱一些。

sentence.Network_en: Beauty is an attitude. It has nothing to do with age.
sentence.Network_cn: 美是一种态度，与年龄无关。

sentence.Network_en: The best thing to do when entering unknown territory is smile.
sentence.Network_cn: 踏入未知地带最好的对策就是微笑。

sentence.Network_en: No matter where you go in life or how old you get, there's always something new to learn about. After all, life is full of surprises.
sentence.Network_cn: 不管你生活在哪里，你有多少岁，总有新东西要学习，毕竟，生活总是充满惊喜。

PerfectNetExp.abs: ...尽管弗罗姆著有许多著作，但《逃避自由》是他最著名的一本。在此书中他论证，正如不能离开对文化内容的解释去理解个人一样，要理解社会过程同样不能不懂得作用于个人的心理过程。“前个人主义社会”给个人以安全，但严重地限制了个人的自由发展。自中世纪的封建秩序解体之后，人已摆脱了传统的束缚，但他并没有在他个人自我实现的积极意义上获得自由。个人主义的历史发展已提供幸福的许多可能，但今天的个人必须有内在勇气去激发他全部的潜能，否则他就会寻求在限制自我的新的依赖形式中逃避他的自由。外界限制的根除不足以使人有积极的自由：
人教版七年级上册英语单词表 ... thing n. 东西；物 to prep. 朝；向；至；达 mom n. 妈妈（非正式用语）.
Sorry , I have to leave early today ., 对不起 , 我今天要早走一会.
小学英语单词(带音标)完美大全2_百度文库 ... go 去 to 给；对 afternoon 下午午后.

list.abs: 大学英语四级常用词组 ... stick out 伸出；坚持到底；显眼 stick to 坚持；忠于；信守 stop by (顺便)访问.
人教版七年级上册英语单词表 ... go to work 去上班 get to 到达 bus n. 公共汽车.
字典中据字的解释 ... (3) 依靠,凭借[ rely on;depend on] (5) 根据[ according to] (7) 占有,占据[ occupy].
大学英语四级常用词组 ... according as 根据…而… according to 根据…所说；按照 account for 说明(原因等)；解释.
95年统测单片集锦 - 豆丁网 ... invest 投资 34 due to 由于 35 runway 跑道 36.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English tō (adverb and preposition), of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch toe and German zu

encyclopedia.content: Transistor 晶体管是一种固体半导体器件，可以用于检波、整流、放大、开关、稳压、信号调制和许多其它功能。晶体管作为一种可变开关，基于输入的电压，控制流出的电流，因此晶体管可做为电流的开关，和一般机械开关（如Relay、switch）不同处在于晶体管是利用电讯号来控制，而且开关速度可以非常之快，在实验室中的切换速度可达100GHz以上。晶体管TO系列封装有TO-89、TO92等等

usage_note.note: In addition to the uses shown below, to is used in phrasal verbs such as ‘see to’ and ‘come to’. It is also used with some verbs that have two objects in order to introduce the second object.
usage_note.translation: 除下列用法外，to 还可用于 see to 和 come to 等短语动词中。它还与某些带双宾语的动词连用，以引出第二个宾语。

entry.def: You use to when indicating the place that someone or something visits, moves towards, or points at.

example.ex: Two friends and I drove to Florida during college spring break...
example.tran: 我和两个朋友在大学春假期间开车去了佛罗里达。

example.ex: Ramsay made a second visit to Italy.
example.tran: 拉姆齐第二次访问意大利。

entry.def: If you go to an event, you go where it is taking place.

example.ex: We went to a party at the leisure centre...
example.tran: 我们去休闲活动中心参加了一个聚会。

example.ex: He came to dinner...
example.tran: 他来赴晚宴了。

entry.def: If something is attached to something larger or fixed to it, the two things are joined together.

example.ex: There was a piece of cloth tied to the dog's collar...
example.tran: 狗项圈上系着一条布。

example.ex: Many patients prefer hand-held shower heads rather than those fixed to the wall…
example.tran: 很多病人更喜欢手握式的淋浴喷头而不是固定在墙上的那种。

entry.def: You use to when indicating the position of something. For example, if something is to your left, it is nearer your left side than your right side.

example.ex: Hemingway's studio is to the right...
example.tran: 海明威的工作室在右面。

example.ex: You will see the chapel on the hill to your left…
example.tran: 你会看见那座小教堂在你左侧的山上。

entry.def: When you give something to someone, they receive it.

example.ex: He picked up the knife and gave it to me...
example.tran: 他捡起刀子递给我。

example.ex: Firms should be allowed to offer jobs to the long-term unemployed at a lower wage.
example.tran: 公司应获许以较低的工资给长期失业的人提供岗位。

entry.tran: (表示动作或情感的对象)对，于
entry.def: You use to to indicate who or what an action or a feeling is directed towards.

example.ex: Marcus has been most unkind to me today...
example.tran: 马库斯今天对我非常无礼。

example.ex: …troops loyal to the government.
example.tran: 忠于政府的军队

entry.tran: (与某些名词、形容词连用，表示关联)对于，关于
entry.def: You use to with certain nouns and adjectives to show that a following noun is related to them.

example.ex: He is a witty man, and an inspiration to all of us...
example.tran: 他机智风趣，鼓舞激励着我们所有人。

example.ex: Marriage is not the answer to everything...
example.tran: 婚姻并不能解决一切问题。

entry.def: If you say something to someone, you want that person to listen and understand what you are saying.

example.ex: I'm going to have to explain to them that I can't pay them.
example.tran: 我将不得不向他们解释我不能付钱给他们。

entry.def: You use to when indicating someone's reaction to something or their feelings about a situation or event. For example, if you say that something happens to someone's surprise you mean that they are surprised when it happens.

example.ex: To his surprise, the bedroom door was locked…
example.tran: 令他吃惊的是，卧室门锁上了。

example.ex: He survived, to the amazement of surgeons.
example.tran: 令外科医生惊讶的是，他竟活下来了。

entry.def: You use to when indicating the person whose opinion you are stating.

example.ex: It was clear to me that he respected his boss...
example.tran: 在我看来他显然很尊重他的上司。

example.ex: Everyone seemed to her to be amazingly kind.
example.tran: 每个人对她来说都善良得不可思议。

entry.def: You use to when indicating what something or someone is becoming, or the state or situation that they are progressing towards.

example.ex: The shouts changed to screams of terror.
example.tran: 喊叫声变成了惊恐的尖叫声。

example.ex: ...an old ranch house that has been converted to a nature centre.
example.tran: 被改建成自然中心的旧农场主住宅

entry.def: To can be used as a way of introducing the person or organization you are employed by, when you perform some service for them.

example.ex: Rickman worked as a dresser to Nigel Hawthorne...
example.tran: 里克曼曾是奈杰尔·霍索恩的服装师。

example.ex: He was an official interpreter to the government of Nepal.
example.tran: 他曾是尼泊尔政府的官方译员。

entry.def: You use to to indicate that something happens until the time or amount mentioned is reached.

example.ex: Every vehicle was banned from coming into Mexico City one day a week from Monday to Friday…
example.tran: 每周一到周五期间都会有一天禁止所有车辆进入墨西哥城。

example.ex: From 1977 to 1985 the United States gross national product grew 21 percent...
example.tran: 从1977到1985年，美国的国民生产总值增长了 21%。

entry.def: You use to when indicating the last thing in a range of things, usually when you are giving two extreme examples of something.

example.ex: I read everything from fiction to history.
example.tran: 从小说到历史，我什么书都读。

example.ex: …mechanical toys and gadgets, from typewriters to toy cars.
example.tran: 从打字机到玩具汽车这样的机械玩具和小巧装置

entry.def: If someone goes from place to place or from job to job, they go to several places, or work in several jobs, and spend only a short time in each one.

example.ex: Larry and Andy had drifted from place to place, worked at this and that.
example.tran: 拉里和安迪从一处漂泊到另一处，干点这个又干点那个。

entry.def: If someone moves to and fro, they move repeatedly from one place to another and back again, or from side to side.

example.ex: She stood up and began to pace to and fro...
example.tran: 她站起身，开始来回踱步。

example.ex: The boat was rocking gently to and fro in the water.
example.tran: 小船在水中轻轻地来回摇荡。

entry.def: You use to when you are stating a time which is less than thirty minutes before an hour. For example, if it is 'five to eight', it is five minutes before eight o'clock.

example.ex: At twenty to six I was waiting by the entrance to the station...
example.tran: 5 点 40 分我正在车站入口处等着。

example.ex: At exactly five minutes to nine, Ann left her car and entered the building.
example.tran: 安在刚好8点55分时下车进了楼。

entry.def: You use to when giving ratios and rates.

example.ex: ...engines that can run at 60 miles to the gallon.
example.tran: 每加仑油跑 60 英里的发动机

example.ex: …a mixture of one part milk to two parts water.
example.tran: 由一份牛奶和两份水兑成的混合物

entry.def: You use to when indicating that two things happen at the same time. For example, if something is done to music, it is done at the same time as music is being played.

example.ex: Romeo left the stage, to enthusiastic applause...
example.tran: 罗密欧在热烈的掌声中离开了舞台。

example.ex: Amy woke up to the sound of her doorbell ringing...
example.tran: 随着门铃叮当作响，埃米醒来了。

entry.def: If you say 'There's nothing to it', 'There's not much to it', or 'That's  all there is to it', you are emphasizing how simple you think something is.

example.ex: Once they have tried growing orchids, they will see there is really nothing to it.
example.tran: 一旦他们试着种植兰花，就会发现那并不是什么难事。

example.ex: She's going through a difficult time. That's all there is to it.
example.tran: 她正经历一个困难时期。就这么简单。

entry.def: If you push or shut a door to, you close it but may not shut it completely.

example.ex: He slipped out, pulling the door to.
example.tran: 他溜了出去，虚掩上门。

collins.item: USED BEFORE THE BASE FORM OF A VERB

entry.tran: (用于动词原形前构成不定式;不定式用于某些动词、名词、形容词以及 how，which,  where 等词之后)。
entry.def: You use to before the base form of a verb to form the to-infinitive. You use the to-infinitive after certain verbs, nouns, and adjectives, and after words such as 'how', 'which', and 'where'.

example.ex: The management wanted to know what I was doing there...
example.tran: 管理层想知道我在那里做什么。

example.ex: She told ministers of her decision to resign...
example.tran: 她告诉了部长们她准备辞职的决定。

entry.tran: (用于动词原形前，表示动作的目的或意图)
entry.def: You use to before the base form of a verb to indicate the purpose or intention of an action.

example.ex: ...using the experience of big companies to help small businesses...
example.tran: 利用大公司的经验帮助小企业

example.ex: He was doing this to make me more relaxed...
example.tran: 他这么做是为了使我更放松。

entry.tran: (用于动词原形前，表示对自己要说的话加以说明)
entry.def: You use to before the base form of a verb when you are commenting on a statement that you are making, for example when saying that you are being honest or brief, or that you are summing up or giving an example.

example.ex: I'm disappointed, to be honest...
example.tran: 说实话，我很失望。

example.ex: Well, to sum up, what is the message that you are trying to get across?
example.tran: 那么，概括来说，你想要传达的信息到底是什么？

entry.tran: (用于感叹句中的动词原形前，强调某一强烈情感)
entry.def: You use to before the base form of a verb in exclamations when you are emphasizing a very strong emotion, such as a desire or wish, or a regret or disappointment.

example.ex: Oh, to think of his poor wife, standing there helpless…
example.tran: 噢！想想他可怜的妻子，无助地站在那里。

example.ex: But then to be let down like that, oh it's so unfair!
example.tran: 但是接下来竟让人如此失望，唉，这真不公平！

entry.tran: (用于动词原形前，表示某一动作之后的情形)
entry.def: You use to before the base form of a verb when indicating what situation follows a particular action.

example.ex: He made his way to the kitchen to find Francis cooking…
example.tran: 他走到厨房，发现弗朗西斯正在做菜。

example.ex: From the garden you walk down to discover a large and beautiful lake...
example.tran: 由花园往前走，你会发现一个宽阔美丽的湖。

entry.def: You use to with 'too' and 'enough' in expressions like too much to and old enough to .

list.explanation: 作变性手术(源出于最初此类手术大多在丹麦进行)
毫无成功或获胜的希塑

example.en: l know they are on a hiding to nothing.
example.zh: 我知道他们丝毫没有获胜的希望。

list.explanation: 上街示威，把本来属于私下的矛盾问题张扬出去

example.en: The debate was quiet for a time, then they took it to the street.
example.zh: 那场争论有一段时间外界并不知逍,他们到后来才闹出来让人知道的。

example.en: Come on, don't take it to the street!
example.zh: 千万千万，不要张扬出去!

list.explanation: 以训诫或惩罚进行要挟某人

example.en: Why can' t Mayor Barry put the wood to school administrators and demand more caring than this?
example.zh: 为什么巴里市长不能以训诫方式要求学校当局多一点关注呢?

list.explanation: (常用于否定句)有能力完成某事的

example.en: He is not able to cut his responsibilities like we thought.
example.zh: 如我们所料，他没有能力完成他的职责。

example.en: Do you think you're able to cut it?
example.zh: 你觉得你能完成这亊吗？

list.explanation: (类似hello的招呼语):

example.en: Earth to Fred! Are you asleep? Say something, Fred!
example.zh: 喂，弗雷德! 你睡着了吗？说话呀，弗雷德!

list.explanation: 遭受重大经济损失，破产

example.en: These investors had been taken to the cleaners.
example.zh: 这些投资者都遭受到了重大经济损失。

list.explanation: 接近完成，到最后关头

example.en: We went right down to the wire on that one.
example.zh: 那一项工作我们已经快完成了。

example.en: It came down to the wire before I turned the proposal in.
example.zh: 我提交计划的最后时刻终于来临了。

list.explanation: (大学生用语)在厕所呕吐

example.en: I think I'd better go home and pray to the porcelain god.
example.zh: 我想我还是回家吐在马桶里的好。

list.explanation: (赞扬和鼓励语)干得非常出色。那太好了

example.en: That's the way to go. You guys built the airport so quickly.
example.zh: 干得非常出色。你们这么快就把机场建成了。

list.explanation: 向(某人)表示祝贺或欢迎

example.en: John put out his hand for me to give me five.
example.zh: 约翰向我伸出手来表示祝贺。

list.explanation: 助(某人)一臂之力，帮(某人)忙

example.en: Hey，give that guy five over here for a minute, will ya?
example.zh: 喂，你到这边来帮那个家伙一下，好吗？

list.explanation: 临近终点，接近尾声

example.en: The project is coming up to the wire and we're a bit nervous.
example.zh: 这项工程现在正接近尾声，所以我们有点儿紧张。

slang.tokens: Do I have to paint (you) a picture. (=Do I have to draw you a picture?)

list.explanation: 你明白没有？要我 给你说明白吗?

example.en: Do I have to draw you a picture or you can visualize this?
example.zh: 这事要我给你说明白呢，还是你自己能想像得出来？

list.explanation: 很可取的，值得拥有的

example.en: We had a beautiful room at the hotel and the service was to die for.
example.zh: 我们住在那家旅馆里，不仅房间很漂亮，而且服务很周到。

list.explanation: (便餐柜台用语)非堂吃的、包好的、买了可以带走的(食品)

example.en: Do you want it to go,or will you eat it here?
example.zh: 你要买包好了外卖的呢，还是要在这儿堂吃的？

list.explanation: 有呕吐感，恶心

example.en: Max felt the urge to purge and ran for the john.
example.zh: 麦克斯感到要呕吐，就跑到厕所去了。

list.explanation: 在情况、情势再紧迫一些时或局势、情况更紧张时

example.en: When push comes to shove，you know I'll be on your side.
example.zh: 等到局势愈发地紧迫，你知道，我会站在你一边的。

list.explanation: 够水平的，满意的，合格，处于良好状态的

example.en: I'm afraid this story isn't quite up to scratch.
example.zh: 我看这篇报道恐怕未必合用。

slang.tokens: have a bone to pick with

list.explanation: 同…有争端'对…有理由怀恨，抱怨(某人或某嚷物)

example.en: They had a bone to pick with neighbouring villages.
example.zh: 他们与邻村曾布过争端端。

example.en: The ambassador had a bone to pick with the student demonstrations.
example.zh: 大使就学生示威一事提出抗议。

list.explanation: (双方或多方)看法一致，同意某一看法

example.en: Gary and Walter see eye to eye on this question.
example.zh: 加里和沃尔特在这一问题上看法完全一致。

example.en: I cannot see eye to eye with him.
example.zh: 我不能同意他的看法。

list.explanation: 极大程度上，大量地

example.en: His ego is big enough to choke a horse.
example.zh: 他极其自负。

list.explanation: a.情况良好的，达到水准的

example.en: He didn't feel up to the knocker.
example.zh: 他感到身体不大舒服。

list.explanation: ad. 十全十美，充分

example.en: He was prepared up to the knocker.
example.zh: 他作了最充分的准备。

list.explanation: 有绝对把握，确信，肯定

example.en: You can bet London to a brick that it'll rain tomorrow.
example.zh: 你可以确信明天会下雨。

list.explanation: 不令人满意的，差劲的，无能的，被弄糊涂的

example.en: The reply was all to cock to me.
example.zh: 那答复不能使我满意。

example.en: You're all to cock! You've done it wrong again !
example.zh: 你真窝囊，又做错了!

example.en: I'm all to cock!
example.zh: 我完全被弄糊涂了!

list.explanation: [黑社会用语] (对某人或某事物是)有所发现的、查明的、了解的

example.en: The cops are wise to the plan.
example.zh: 警方对那计划是作过查证的。

example.en: I'mwise to Lefty. He's a spy.
example.zh: 我对莱夫蒂是有所了解的。他是个间渫。

list.explanation: 微不足道，引不起兴趣，不令人兴奋，不十分好

example.en: I got a little bit of a raise this year，but it was nothing to write home about.
example.zh: 今年我得到一点提升，但并不值得一提。

example.en: His pitch was nothing to write home about.
example.zh: 他的情况不十分好。

list.explanation: 忙乱，喧闹，骚扰，骚动

example.en: They made quite a to-do about the broken window.
example.zh: 他们对那打破玻璃窗的事吵闹不休。

list.explanation: 难打交道的或难以理解的人或事，难以办到的事

example.en: I wish Jill wasn't such a tough nut to crack.
example.zh: 我希望吉尔不是个那么难打交道的人。

example.en: This problem is a tough egg to crack.
example.zh: 这一问题可真令人难以理解。

example.en: Getting them all here on time will be a tough nul to crack.
example.zh: 要他们全都准时到将是件很难办到的事。

list.explanation: (与…)斗殴、激烈竞争或争论

example.en: They soon stopped sparring and went to the mat.
example.zh: 他们刚吵了几句，接着就打起来了。

example.en: The union may go to the mat with the management over wages.
example.zh: 工会可能与资方就工资问题进行激烈争论。

list.explanation: 断然鄙弃、不接受(某人的某事物)

example.en: She told me rudely what to do with my proffered assistance.
example.zh: 她粗暴地断然拒绝了我提供的协助。

list.explanation: 生气的

example.en: I' m not just to'd off! I' m enraged.
example.zh: 我不仅仅是生气!我是火冒三丈。

slang.tokens: not able to hold a candle to

list.explanation: 无法与…相比或媲美

example.en: The cake from the bakery is not able to hold a candle to the one that Grandmonther made.
example.zh: 店里买来的蛋糕跟奶奶做的无法相比。

list.explanation: 臭气熏天

example.en: This kitchen smells to high heaven. What besides garlic are you cooking?
example.zh: 厨房里臭气熏天。除了大蒜之外，你还在烧什么菜？

list.explanation: 发出可疑信号

example.en: Something's wrong here. Somebody blabbed. This setup smells to heaven.
example.zh: 这儿出 了点问题。有人泄露了秘密。这台检测器发出了可疑信号。

list.explanation: (对生活或情况)熟悉的，了解的，知情的

example.en: As the days rolled on I commenced getting hep to the jive.
example.zh: 随着日子 一天一天过去，我开始懂得人情世故了。

auth_sentence.content: Abdul Kadar was content to play a waiting game.
auth_sentence.res_content: Abdul Kadar was content to play a waiting game.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Abdul Kadar was content to play a waiting game.

auth_sentence.content: Colin Oates also made it through to his quarter-finals.
auth_sentence.res_content: Colin Oates also made it through to his quarter-finals.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Colin Oates also made it through to his quarter-finals.

auth_sentence.content: What does the new homepage allow me to do?
auth_sentence.res_content: What does the new homepage allow me to do?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: What does the new homepage allow me to do?

abbreviation.mean_cn: (西班牙语)卷，册，体积，量，大量，音量
关掉，避开，使转变方向，生产，制造，用车床加工出，使厌烦，变成
翻转，倒置；调换，转换；周转额

Sentence.sentence: Believe it or not, that's the number of Americans who struggle with hanger To make tomorrow a little better, Feeding America, the nation's largest domestic hunger-relief organization, has chosen September as Hunger Action Month.
Evaluating Risks To decide whether a risk is worth taking, you must examine the consequences, in the future as well as right now, negative as well as positive, and to others as well as to yourself.

means.word_mean: (表示时间)到, 直到, 在…到来之前, 离…

sentences.en: The Parliament was prorogued to the tenth of February.

means.word_mean: (表示方向)朝, 往, 通向

sentences.en: He turned to his companion before he replied.
sentences.cn: 他转身朝向他的伙伴然后回答。

means.word_mean: (表示状态)紧贴着, 紧靠着, 对着

sentences.en: The two lovers danced cheek to cheek.
sentences.cn: 那对情侣脸贴着脸跳舞。

means.word_mean: (表示对象)对, 对于, 对…来说

sentences.en: What will Doris say to it?
sentences.cn: 对此事多丽丝将怎么说呢?

sentences.en: The men are noodles to her.
sentences.cn: 与她相比, 这些男人都是笨蛋。

means.word_mean: (表示方位)在…方向[方位], 处于…顺序

sentences.en: Scotland is to the north of England.
It is ten kilometres to the station.
We came to a picturesque cottage.
sentences.cn: 我们来到一座风景如画的村落。

means.word_mean: (表示结果)转换为, 转变为, 趋于

sentences.en: Wait until the lights change to green.
sentences.cn: 等交通灯变成绿色再走。
把这个加在另外几个上面

means.word_mean: [表示伴随]跟着； 伴随；随同

sentences.en: What will he say to this?
His hat is on wrong side to.
We turned to with a will.
We were close to when it happened.
sentences.cn: 事情发生时我们正在附近。

jushi.english: A walk of ten miles was nothing to him.
jushi.chinese: 走十英里对他来说不算什么。

jushi.english: They have come to her aid.
